thread.title: Dele Alli set to be one of the new faces for FIFA video game as Bayern Munich join queue of admirers
thread.title_full: Dele Alli set to be one of the new faces for FIFA video game as Bayern Munich join queue of admirers

author: John Cross
title: Dele Alli set to be one of the new faces for FIFA video game as Bayern Munich join queue of admirers
text:
Dele Alli set to be one of the new faces for FIFA video game as Bayern Munich join queue of admirers The German side are the latest European giant to show their interest in the England midfielder Share Alli could find himself on the front of the new FIFA game Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Dele Alli is set to be one of the new faces of video game FIFA - and his global appeal has put another European superpower on red alert. 
German giants Bayern Munich are the latest club to show an interest in Tottenham’s red-hot England midfielder. 
They join Real Madrid, Barcelona and Paris Saint Germain as big admirers for 20-year-old Alli who has emerged as the biggest young prospect in Europe. 
Bayern are keeping close tabs and could make a move this summer given any encouragement while Barcelona and Real Madrid believe they could tempt him to Spain. Some of Europe's biggest teams are watching Alli (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Tottenham have tied Alli to a long term contract until 2022 and they will definitely attempt to fend off any big money bids this summer. 
But in the longer term, Tottenham will face a major battle to keep Alli whose form in the Premier League is also making him one of the most marketable players in the world. 
That is why games giants EA Sports have already discussed making him the face of the next FIFA game which, in modern football terms, is a highly prestigious compliment. Lionel Messi is among the cover stars of the past. Alli's stock is rising quickly (Photo: Clive Rose/Getty Images) 
It shows Alli’s popularity and growing name and reputation both as a player and also marketing brand. 
Tottenham know they have one of the most sought after players in Europe and if they do eventually sell then it would take a huge bid. 
Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy is regarded as a tough negotiator and he will fight to keep the England star, having got a world record £85m fee for Gareth Bale when he joined Real Madrid. poll loading Should Dele Alli be on the front of the next FIFA game? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
